By  James KrauseOctober  

DeKALB  The DeKalb Public Library will host an event Saturday meant to tell the story of a war hero and entertainer of the furry variety PERIOD

Public speaker and storyteller Adrian Brigham will be joined by his wife recording artistDenise Brigham to tell the story of Smoky the War Dog PERIOD The event will run from  to  p.m PERIOD

Adrian contacted us and we were open to do it Head of Adult Services Teresa Iverson said PERIOD World War II history is always perennially interesting to our patrons. smoky a four pound female Yorkie is said to have been discovered by American soldersat the bottom of a fox hole inPapua New Guinea during World War II PERIOD Smoky is credited as having been in  battles during the war earning eight battle stars PERIOD

Smoky has also been identified as the worlds first therapy dog on record accommodating nurses at233rd Station Hospital in July  PERIOD

After the war Smoky appeared on various television shows in Cleveland where Smoky lived with his owner William Wynne PERIOD

Smoky died in  and was buried in the Cleveland Metroparks in an ammunition box PERIOD In  a statue paying tribute to Smoky was unveiled at her resting spot PERIOD

Joining the Brighams will be their own dog another four pound Yorkie named Hairy Pawter to play the role of Smokey PERIOD Together the group will play out the life of Smoky as well as pay tribute to the Yorkie Doodle Dandy. the event is free open to attendees of all ages and registration is not required PERIOD More information can be found on the DeKalb Public Library website PERIOD
